text: Hi all, I'm trying to use the enroll function for a chain, but I'm failing to understand the syntax of "chain.registerAndEnroll( registrationRequest, function(err, user) {"
Is it possible to return user so that it can be used later in the code?
It would appear that it never actually enters the function to enroll webAppAdmin

<@U3H68QR7X> the “registerAndEnroll()” function is an asynchronous call, so you don’t get the resulting user returned from the function call. instead you pass in a call back function that gets called by registerAndEnroll() with “err, user” parameters. so you’ll handle the resulting user object in the callback function
